utterance.speaker: GANZ
utterance.content: You should have stayed out of this, Royce.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: You have no idea the hell that’s about to rain down on you.

utterance.speaker: GANZ
utterance.content: Scary.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where is he?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Turn around and go back home and let me handle this, all right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, I’ve seen dead bodies before.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: C’mon, Kate. You don’t want to remember him like this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, if it was me lying there would you just walk away?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I’m so sorry, honey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Just tell me what happened?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: He was shot in the leg. Judging from the blood trail, I’d say the bullet broke the bone. He tried to hide, but… I found this in his pocket. He just flew in from Los Angeles this afternoon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What was he doing in LA?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I heard he moved there after he lost his bounty hunter's license. I guess he was trying to make a fresh start.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When was the last time you spoke to him?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When I arrested him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie, could I?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Royce uh, had something else in his pocket. It’s addressed to you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is it about the case?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We got the murder weapon. Found it in the garbage around the corner.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It was definitely fired recently. Shooter took the time to empty the ammo before he dumped it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Worried we’d find fingerprints on the bullets?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This is a cheap street gun. It’s a throw away. There’s threading on the barrel.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A silencer?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Allowing our killer to shoot Royce in broad daylight.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Listen, Beckett, we’re going to get this guy. We’ve got uniforms hitting every store and apartment in a five block radius.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This is New York. Somebody had to have seen something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: LA to New York. It’s like Royce was running from something. Like he knew he was in danger.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. You were right about the silencer. The lab found trace amounts of titanium alloy in the threads. They’ve narrowed it down to one of two commercial suppressors. Both run about a grand.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why put an expensive silencer on a cheap gun?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because … our killer followed Royce from LA and couldn’t bring his own gun on the plane.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But a silencer is just a cylinder. It could easily be hidden in a checked bag.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Isolate all the flights that someone could have followed Royce from LA on. There couldn’t have been that many. And specifically focus on the people who might have bought tickets last minute.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What were you into, Mike?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay, so we got five flights out of LA that meet our criteria. I ran all the passengers and one name popped. Neil McCauley. He bought his ticket at the airport an hour before the flight. His identity is brand new, no credit history, and his driver’s license number is a fake.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Neil McCauley? Really?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s Robert De Niro’s character in Heat.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s our guy.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, if it is, you’re going to need to get on a plane, because Mr. McCauley flew back to LA two hours after Royce was shot.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: I’m not sending you to LA. You have no solid evidence linking Neil McCauley to this murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He came to New York for six hours. Who flies in for that short a stay?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Businessmen do it all the time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Businessmen don’t use false ids.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or pack a silencer?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: That’s supposition. I need a lot more than that to justify flying a detective across the country.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You and I both know that the longer I wait to go out there, the colder this trail gets.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Take a day. Shore this up. And if there’s sufficient evidence I’ll contact LAPD.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’ll contact the LAPD? This is my case. This happened in our jurisdiction. You think the LAPD is going to lift a finger?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Kate, you’re too close to this!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No sir, I am committed. I am not compromised.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: You’re torn up!

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Kate, things between you and Royce ended badly. I get it. But that emotion is exactly why I need to assign this to someone else.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what? You’re right. I am too close to this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I have some vacation days coming up. I think now would be a good time.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Kate. I hope you’re not thinking of doing something reckless.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, sir.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where’re you going?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Home.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The hell you are.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle. Please. He was my training officer. My friend. I just … I really need to be alone right now.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: Dear Kate, I bet I’ve written this letter a hundred times. Someday I might actually send it. There’s no excuse for what I did, especially what I did to you. But I’m on a righteous path now, and I hope one day that path earns me your forgiveness.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: FLIGHT ATTENDANT
utterance.content: Excuse me, Detective Beckett?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes?

utterance.speaker: FLIGHT ATTENDANT
utterance.content: You’ve been upgraded to first class.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry. Excuse me. Sorry about that.

utterance.speaker: FLIGHT ATTENDANT
utterance.content: Seat 3C.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Champagne?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, what are you doing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, the studio has been after me for weeks to fly down and do a set visit for the Heat Wave movie. Imagine my surprise when I saw your name on the standby list.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You cannot be a part of what I’m going to do out there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I thought you were on vacation.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle. It is one thing for you to follow me when we are in New York. But I am not a cop in LA. I don’t have any authority. Or backup.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ll be your backup. Besides, going rogue is kind of my specialty.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but subtlety isn’t. I’m not going to get rid of you, am I? Okay, look. If we do this together, you have to promise me that we’re going to fly under the radar.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is this what you call under the radar?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: In LA? This baby fits right in. So what’s our first stop?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: My hotel. It’s on Ventura Boulevard.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s all the way in the Valley. How are we supposed to work together if you’re an hour away?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, we weren’t supposed to work together at all.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, look. The studio comp’ed me a two bedroom, four star suite. You just stay with me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hah! Yeah, right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What? You’ll have your own room.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, no. No. I am not staying with you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah. Worried you can’t control yourself when we’re alone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Actually, it’s not me that I’m worried about.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I can assure you, my intentions are pure.

utterance.speaker: MAURICE
utterance.content: We’re so happy to have you back, Mr. Castle. I’ve taken the liberty of setting up the suitet just the way you like it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: MAURICE
utterance.content: And I’ve scheduled a couples massage at seven.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Pure, huh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, Maurice, you can go ahead and cancel that. And get rid of the flowers and the champagne. We’re here to work.

utterance.speaker: MAURICE
utterance.content: Very good, sir.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: For you. Thank you, Maurice.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The last time I was here I brought this Parisian supermodel, so he thought … it’s not important. Would you like to choose your room?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. I’d like to start the investigation.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We haven’t even ordered room service yet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I’m not here for room service. I’m here for justice.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow. In LA for all of a minute and already she’s spouting cheesy movie dialogue. Must be something in the air.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is Royce’s house?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This was the address listed on his driver’s license.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did I miss the part where you told me he was rich?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, he was barely scraping by.

utterance.speaker: INTERCOM VOICE
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m a friend of Mike Royce’s.

utterance.speaker: INTERCOM VOICE
utterance.content: Come around the back.

utterance.speaker: GENE SIMMONS
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Woah, you’re Gene Simmons.

utterance.speaker: GENE SIMMONS
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m that weird guy in KISS. Yeah, the guy with the long tongue and everything. Hello … who’s this pretty little lady?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m Detective Kate Beckett. NYPD.

utterance.speaker: GENE SIMMONS
utterance.content: Is Mike in trouble?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Actually, he was murdered.

utterance.speaker: GENE SIMMONS
utterance.content: Oh, that’s terrible.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How did you know him, exactly?

utterance.speaker: GENE SIMMONS
utterance.content: Well, I got into trouble a few months back and Royce helped me out. I helped him and I’ve been letting him live in my guest house.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you’re saying he was in the business of helping people in trouble?

utterance.speaker: GENE SIMMONS
utterance.content: He was pretty good at it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Was he helping anyone lately?

utterance.speaker: GENE SIMMONS
utterance.content: Well, there was a girl … she came by two days ago. She was really beautiful. Stunning.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This girl. Do you remember her name?

utterance.speaker: GENE SIMMONS
utterance.content: You know what? She dropped off a headshot. If you give me a chance I’ll go find it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is so weird.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ve dressed up as him for Halloween.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I did, too.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Violet Young. A smoking hot wannabe starlet whose only credit is Slumber Party Zombie.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What kind of trouble would an actress be in that would scare Royce into running? What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Pulling up Slumber Party Zombie on NetFlix.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m going to get a hold of Violet’s agent. See if I can find out where she is.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, Ryan. What’s up?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We got lucky. Kids were tagging that building across from the alley so the owner put up a camera. There’s our shooter.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You can’t see his face or the license plate number.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But you can see the driver’s arm.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: A black guy. Ebony to our killer’s ivory.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Still got that friend at TSA?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, why?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Maybe they’ll share surveillance footage of the security checkpoint that our shooter went through. Guy was in town for six hours, right? There’s a chance that he’s wearing the same clothes at the airport that he’s wearing in our video.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Which might get us a look at his face.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So Violet’s shooting a commercial at Zenith Studios.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No way. That’s where they’re shooting Heat Wave. It’s kismet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Violet’s commercial shoots on stage seven.

utterance.speaker: TONY
utterance.content: Rick Castle! Aha, I can’t believe we finally got you out here!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Tony, you money grubbing bastard. How’s filming?

utterance.speaker: TONY
utterance.content: You kidding me? It’s awesome, buddy. You keep writing them, we’ll keep making them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Tony, I want you to meet Kate Beckett. This is the inspiration for Nikki Heat.

utterance.speaker: TONY
utterance.content: Wow, with your looks, honey, you could be an actress.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ah, I’m completely comfortable being a cop. I’m going to go and look for Violet. It was nice to meet you.

utterance.speaker: TONY
utterance.content: You too.

utterance.speaker: TONY
utterance.content: She’s hot. No wonder your sex scenes are so steamy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So uh, where’s our Nikki Heat, Natalie Rhodes?

utterance.speaker: TONY
utterance.content: Natalie is having some personal issues.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What kind of personal issues?

utterance.speaker: TONY
utterance.content: Let’s just say there was a slight mix up with one of her prescriptions.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She’s in rehab?

utterance.speaker: TONY
utterance.content: Hey, you did not hear that from me. Oh, there are the actors that play Raley and Ochoa. Huerve, Taylor!

utterance.speaker: OCHOA ACTOR
utterance.content: It’s Herve.

utterance.speaker: TONY
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s what I said. This is your creator, Richard Castle.

utterance.speaker: OCHOA ACTOR
utterance.content: Yo, big fan, bro.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: RALEY ACTOR
utterance.content: I’ve read all your books. If you have time I’d love to talk about my motivation.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: RALEY ACTOR
utterance.content: I mean, what’s my character’s motivation? Why do I do what I do?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah. You’re a cop, so it’s your job.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, Violet didn’t show up to work today. I just talked to her agent. He said there’s no way she would have missed this commercial. This is a huge break for her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ve got her address.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You think she’s in trouble?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, or worse.

utterance.speaker: OCHOA ACTOR
utterance.content: You guys on the job?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You guys look great.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That is just creepy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Totally.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hola, chica.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I was in the neighborhood.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I thought I’d stop by and see if those bullets you pulled out of Royce were ready to go over to ballistics. I’ve got a friend there who’ll make sure they get processed right away.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Wait, wait, wait. Is your friend that top heavy tramp in reception?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Huh? Wha- I – you know I only have eyes for you. I don’t even …

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Uh huh … you know I have easy access to sharp objects.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: What the hell?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Are those the bullets?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Yeah. They’re dissolving.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I mean, ice bullets I’ve heard of, but dissolving bullets?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Violet? Violet Young?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’d think somebody on my conspiracy websites would have mentioned them. I don’t think anybody’s home.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You sure this is okay?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, it is not okay. It is actually completely illegal.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hello? Violet?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t smell a dead body.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She’s not here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nope. She’s not. She’s in New York.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This was Royce’s flight. Okay so, they flew together. He probably knew that they were in trouble and he tried to protect her by taking her to New York.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Protect her from what?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe from this? Surveillance photos? What would she be doing with surveillance photos?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe Royce was doing some kind of PI work for her? The building this guy’s coming out of looks familiar.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She has articles on corgies, on surfing, wine tasting? How does any of this add up?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe she was researching a role.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what role would that be?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And what does any of it have to do with Royce?

utterance.speaker: VOICE RECORDER
utterance.content: The power of sound compels you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Cops, cops, cops!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Photo!

utterance.speaker: LAPD UNIFORM
utterance.content: LAPD! Don’t move!

utterance.speaker: KYLE SEEGER
utterance.content: Afternoon. Kyle Seeger. Robbery, homicide.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, Kyle, this is a misunderstanding. I –

utterance.speaker: SEEGER
utterance.content: Meaning you didn’t pick the lock or illegally enter this house?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Meaning, she’s NYPD.

utterance.speaker: SEEGER
utterance.content: I know who you are, Detective. And while I can appreciate your loss, I can’t have you and your off beat sidekick running around my town committing felonies in some misguided quest for justice.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you … are you arresting us?

utterance.speaker: SEEGER
utterance.content: Much worse. Somebody wants to have a word with you.

utterance.speaker: SEEGER
utterance.content: You’re on speaker, sir.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Breaking into people’s houses? That’s your idea of a vacation, Beckett?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, I can explain. I was –

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: No, you cannot. What you can do is get your ass on the next plane out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, we have a dinner reservation at Spago. Is the morning okay?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Oh, this is all a big joke to you, isn’t it, Castle? When Beckett is working mall security, following her around isn’t going to have quite the same allure. Both of you. Come home. Now.

utterance.speaker: SEEGER
utterance.content: Wow. That was awkward.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, unless there is something else, I think we should go now.

utterance.speaker: SEEGER
utterance.content: Hey, one last thing. Did you find what you were looking for?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wrong house.

utterance.speaker: SEEGER
utterance.content: Welcome to LA, Detective. Now go home.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Will Montgomery really fire you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So we’re back to New York.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hell, no.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Detective Ryan.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, it’s me. Can you talk?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah … about Montgomery. He’s seriously fired up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I know. Look, I need a favor from you, but you can feel free to say no.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, c’mon. Whatever it is I’m saying yes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay great, thanks. We think that Royce had company when he traveled to New York. Her name is Violet Young. Whatever trouble he was into, she was involved somehow.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You think she’s still in town?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Unless McCauley got to her first. Her headshot lists an acting school in New York; she might have friends out there. Can you see if she contacted any of them?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You got it. I’ll keep you posted.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Great. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, Esposito’s got something. Beckett, line two.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: ‘Sup, girl? How’s the weather in your world?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sunny, chance of ass kicking. What’ve you got?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: A photo of our killer, courtesy of TSA. I’m shooting it over to you now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And that’s Neil McCauley?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Or whoever he is. He wore the exact same clothes at JFK as he did in that alley. That’s how we got him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, look, this is a long shot, but run facial recognition through the federal and local databases.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You got it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I found him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Neil McCauley?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. The mystery man from the photo in Violet’s place? I realized where I had seen that building he was coming out of before. It was the bad guys' headquarters in Primal Fury: Primal Vengeance. So, did a little internet search and, bam said the lady, found it’s the home of Kelvin North America. Some kind of R and D facility, the chief executive office is Charles Kelvin. Guess what his hobbies are?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wine, corgies, and surfing. Violet was studying him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Kelvin! Mr. Kelvin!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Your assistant said we could find you here.

utterance.speaker: KELVIN
utterance.content: This is my surf hour. So whatever you have to say, it can wait until I’m done.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, it can’t. I’m Detective Kate Beckett, this is Richard Castle. Do you recognize this woman?

utterance.speaker: KELVIN
utterance.content: Sure. I met her in line for coffee last Friday. I asked her out. Thought the date was going well until she went to the bathroom and never came back. What’s this all about anyway? Something happen to her?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Does this recording mean anything to you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Isnt’ that your voice?

utterance.speaker: KELVIN
utterance.content: That *****.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What does that mean?

utterance.speaker: KELVIN
utterance.content: That phrase is our key to the high security vault. Violet must have pieced it together from the words I said during the date. I’ve got to get back to the office.

utterance.speaker: KELVIN
utterance.content: Ohhh… gone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What was in here?

utterance.speaker: KELVIN
utterance.content: That’s proprietary information.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A bullet. I’m guessing it dissolves.

utterance.speaker: KELVIN
utterance.content: How do you know about those?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They were used in a murder.

utterance.speaker: KELVIN
utterance.content: God. We created them to try to land a defense contract in ultra light ammunition. The dissolving property was a complete accident. Unfortunately it rendered the bullets completely useless to the military.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but valuable to someone else.

utterance.speaker: KELVIN
utterance.content: How the hell did this happen?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey! Good news on Violet.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You found her?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ah ha… not that good. But she is alive. Or at least she was, last night. Tracked down an ex of hers, said she showed up on his doorstep, scared out of her mind. Told him she had come out from LA with Royce but he had disappeared, so the ex let her stay the night. The next morning, Violet was gone, so was his wallet.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He know where she was headed?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, no. But two hours later a large, African American gentleman with a fondness for kidney punches showed up and asked that very same question.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The driver who picked up McCauley.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh huh, that’s what I was thinking. Worked him over pretty good, too.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Let’s get him with a sketch artist.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Way ahead of you, bro.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Looks like we’re not the only ones hunting for Violet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Picture this. A gullible young actress, desperate to make a name for herself. She meets our mastermind at a club. He needs a pretty girl to help him get the voice code. He tells Violet he’s a producer, promises to make her famous, if she helps him play a practical joke on a friend.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She doesn’t even realize she’s participating in a crime until afterwards. She can’t call the cops, so she contacts Royce.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But then our Mr. McCauley finds out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And Royce tries to change the game. He goes to New York. Home field advantage. Classic, classic Royce.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I was so in awe of him, Castle, when I first met him. I just hung on his every word. And then later I realized he was just making up stories to mess with me. I can’t believe that I’m never going to see him again.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know what I thought when I first met you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hmm?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That you were a mystery that I was never gonna solve. Even now, after spending all this time with you I’m … I’m still amazed at the depth of your strength, your heart … and your hotness.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re not so bad yourself, Castle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I should go. It’s late. Good night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kate.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Good night, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow. Somebody’s up early.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What, did you pack a murder board?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Concierge. Called down and then ten minutes later … voila.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, Maurice is amazing, isn’t he? I bet if I ordered the Ark of the Covenant he’d come through.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wouldn’t you be afraid to open it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. It only melts Nazis. Is that Kelvin North America?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m trying to figure out this heist. Kelvin said that the last time that vault was accessed was at eleven forty-six Tuesday night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, that must be when our thieves stole the hi-tech ammo.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Eight hundred pounds worth. And they would have had to take it out the loading dock.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But that guard station there. I remember seeing that when we went in. There’s no way they could get all that ammo past him without a little insider help.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Exactly. So I called the security company and they said that the only guard that was stationed at the loading bay that night was some guy named Reggie Walsh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I feel the plot about to thicken.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He asked to be reassigned the next day.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you expecting anyone?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, wait, wait wait.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Detective Seeger.

utterance.speaker: SEEGER
utterance.content: Mr. Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do come in.

utterance.speaker: SEEGER
utterance.content: Wow. Nice digs. Sure pays to travel with a bestselling author, huh?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Seeger, if you’re here to drive us to the airport, we’re not packed yet.

utterance.speaker: SEEGER
utterance.content: I’m here because a report crossed my desk. About a theft. At Kelvin North America.

utterance.speaker: SEEGER
utterance.content: Your names jumped out at me. Now tell me, what does a theft of hi-tech bullets have to do with your murder investigation?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re not investigating a murder anymore, remember? We’re off the case.

utterance.speaker: SEEGER
utterance.content: Are we going to do that dance?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, we don’t know any more about that theft than you do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But if we stumble across something on our way to the airport we’ll be sure to let you know.

utterance.speaker: SEEGER
utterance.content: See that you do.

utterance.speaker: SEEGER
utterance.content: Detective.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Goodbye.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you sure it’s such a good idea, cutting him out? He might be able to help us.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, the only thing Seeger cares about is that robbery, not Royce’s murder. What we need to do is question that guard, Reggie Walsh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but how? You’re not a cop here, remember?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Reggie doesn’t need to know that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh.

utterance.speaker: REGGIE
utterance.content: Like I told you, I don’t know anything about a robbery.

utterance.speaker: RALEY ACTOR
utterance.content: Give me a break, Reggie.

utterance.speaker: OCHOA ACTOR
utterance.content: You’re lying.

utterance.speaker: RALEY ACTOR
utterance.content: You’re a punk.

utterance.speaker: OCHOA ACTOR
utterance.content: A dirty scowl. A low down rat bastard.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Easy, guys.

utterance.speaker: REGGIE
utterance.content: Yeah, I mean, we all wear the uniform, right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, and I just hope yours makes you look good on TV.

utterance.speaker: REGGIE
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The news camera outside the precinct? They just love a good perp walk, Reggie. And if you’re messed up in this, I’m sure you wouldn’t want to be seen talking to the cops, so as a courtesy, I’m going to let you cover up with my jacket.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I wouldn’t take it off before we get into the interview room, though. There might be reporters on the inside.

utterance.speaker: REGGIE
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re a security guard, Reggie. In prison? You’re the lowest of the low.

utterance.speaker: REGGIE
utterance.content: I thought that was child molesters?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, well … dude. Security guard. And you know what they do to guys like you in Longbauch.

utterance.speaker: REGGIE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: TONY
utterance.content: This is a latte. I drink chai tea lattes. How long do you have to work for me before you get that right, huh? Or maybe –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: C’mon, Reggie. We know you were at the loading bay that night.

utterance.speaker: REGGIE
utterance.content: All right, um… these two guys came to me. Offered me five hundred buck to take a cigarette break at midnight. The only reason I went along is because saying no didn’t really seem like an option.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are these the men?

utterance.speaker: REGGIE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did they give you their names?

utterance.speaker: REGGIE
utterance.content: No. Oh, but when they were walking away? The black guy called the other guy Ganz.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right guys, thanks very much. We’re done with the room.

utterance.speaker: REGGIE
utterance.content: What the hell?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Welcome to Hollywood.

utterance.speaker: TONY
utterance.content: Great scene, Ricky. Who said she was a star? That’s right, me.

utterance.speaker: REGGIE
utterance.content: Does this mean I can leave?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: His name is Russell Ganz. He’s suspected of pulling several high profile heists during the last five years, including the theft of military grade circuit boards in 2009. Ganz is very smart and very violent. His multimillion dollar scores have allowed him to live like royalty – fast cars, hot women …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Dissolving bullets would be worth a fortune for the right buyer, like a gang or a drug cartel. Do we have an LA address for Ganz? Or any known associates?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Negative on the address and it looks like most of his friends are incarcerated. Wait … here’s one that’s not. Donald Mannis. He looks exactly like the guy hunting Violet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, Mannis might lead us to Ganz, so let's get his photo to all the troops.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Got it. I’ll get back to you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We gotta find Ganz fast. Once he fences those bullets he’s going to disappear.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don’t worry. The guy likes the perks of wealth. I know just the guy to help find him.

utterance.speaker: MAURICE
utterance.content: Oh, Mr. Ganz is well known within my network. He’s a frequent guest at our city’s five star hotels.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you actually know where he is?

utterance.speaker: MAURICE
utterance.content: At a pool side cabana at the Eastway. He enjoys being surrounded by beautiful women as he conducts business on the phone, which, according to a poolside waiter, he’s doing as we speak.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maurice, thank you very much. You never fail to amaze.

utterance.speaker: MAURICE
utterance.content: My pleasure, sir. Ma’am.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so if Ganz is doing business poolside, he’s probably trying to find a buyer for those bullets. If I can put him with those bullets I can prove he killed Royce.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don’t you think it’s time we called the LAPD?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I think I have a better idea.

utterance.speaker: GANZ
utterance.content: Time for a celebration. Set it up in an hour, will you, man?

utterance.speaker: GANZ
utterance.content: I appreciate a woman who knows how to make an entrance. Are you staying at the hotel?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, I’m meeting someone.

utterance.speaker: GANZ
utterance.content: Business or pleasure?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hopefully a bit of both. Mr. Ganz. I’m Lola Black. Please, sit.

utterance.speaker: GANZ
utterance.content: What can I do for you, Ms. Black?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I represent a small but powerful group of Colombian business interests. They understand you’re in possession of some … unique merchandise.

utterance.speaker: GANZ
utterance.content: Mmm. I’m afraid you’ve got me confused with someone else.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, I don’t think so. That business in New York - that ex cop? It was a very effective product demonstration. My offer is serious, and my clients are not accustomed to hearing the word no.

utterance.speaker: GANZ
utterance.content: Well, bidding on that particular item closed about twenty minutes ago. Better luck next time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, uh… two million. I can have it here within an hour.

utterance.speaker: GANZ
utterance.content: I’m impressed, actually. The way you lured me in. You had me guessing there for a second.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s that supposed to mean?

utterance.speaker: GANZ
utterance.content: It means you’re a cop. You’re the hottest thing to come out of major crimes in quite some time. But you’re a little too eager, too green. Nice meeting you, Lola.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh God, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So what happened?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ow!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I was trying to keep him from seeing you and so I pushed too hard and he made me … he called me green, Castle! What the hell were you doing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I saw his phone in the cabana. I thought it was worth the risk.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You took his phone?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No! No, I took a picture of his recent call list.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What? Where is it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don’t poke me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Poke you? I want to kiss you!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, we need to run down these numbers, see if we can trace one to Ganz’s buyer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, now can we call Seeger?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Gentlemen. Where are we with Violet Young?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Just got off the phone with her mother. Says she remembers Violet having a roommate who lives near Canal Street.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, and we’re going to head over there and see if Violet reached out to her.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Well, let me know.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Hey, you heard form Beckett?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, sir.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, me neither.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: She’s not answering her cell?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe she’s airborne.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ah, yeah, that would explain her phone being turned off.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Huh. You know, I’m trying to decide who is the worse liar, him or you.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Go find Violet Young. Help Beckett put this thing to bed, all right?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yes, sir.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right on.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, Detective Seege-

utterance.speaker: SEEGER
utterance.content: You run wild in my city and then you call me for a favor? You got a lot of nerve, Detective, I’ll give you that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, we’re trying to get a vicious criminal off of your streets.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, can I interest you in one of these robes? Before you say no, feel how soft this is.

utterance.speaker: SEEGER
utterance.content: No. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, we’re all on the same team now, so why don’t we just get this done with?

utterance.speaker: SEEGER
utterance.content: As long as it gets done my way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Fine, what do you got?

utterance.speaker: SEEGER
utterance.content: Well, Ganz’s phone is a burner and so are most of the numbers he called.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which means you didn’t get the buyer’s id.

utterance.speaker: SEEGER
utterance.content: We did manage to trace one of the burners he called to New York City.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mannis. That’s Ganz’s partner.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I bet Ganz was calling to ask why the hell Violet Young was still alive. Did you happen to get a location on Mannis’ phone?

utterance.speaker: SEEGER
utterance.content: Just that it’s in Manhattan.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so let’s call him, rile him up a bit.

utterance.speaker: SEEGER
utterance.content: Rile him up how?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ll tell him I met Ganz. Ganz was going to cut him out of the deal; Mannis wasn’t pulling his weight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mannis gets pissed, he calls Ganz, maybe one of them lets something slip about the location of the exchange.

utterance.speaker: SEEGER
utterance.content: And we’ll be listening. Good. I’ll try to get a warrant.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You’re a hard girl to find, Violet.

utterance.speaker: VIOLET
utterance.content: I know it was wrong to run, but … I was afraid to go to the cops. I never meant for Royce to get hurt.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, let’s just get back to the station. We can work it out, all right?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Gun!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, you?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You okay? Wait right here, all right?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Esposito?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Beckett?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you with Mannis?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, I just shot him. Wait, why are you calling him?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, we need to know where and when Ganz is selling those bullets.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Don. Where’s the deal going down?

utterance.speaker: MANNIS
utterance.content: I’m hit, man. Call an ambulance.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, my partner’s on that.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: 9 … 1 … what comes after that one?

utterance.speaker: MANNIS
utterance.content: I’m in pain here, man!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s over, Mannis. You give us the meet location and I’ll tell the DA in LA that you cooperated.

utterance.speaker: MANNIS
utterance.content: Okay! Santa Monica Pier! Six o’clock! Now call an ambulance!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Who shot Royce?

utterance.speaker: MANNIS
utterance.content: It was Ganz.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You get that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, we got it. Thanks. We gotta get to Santa Monica Pier.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s quarter of six now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This is going to be our last chance to get Ganz.

utterance.speaker: SEEGER
utterance.content: Okay, let’s roll.

utterance.speaker: SEEGER
utterance.content: LAPD. Freeze. Put the case down. Put the case down! Put your hands behind your head.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You in the van! Police! Both hands out the window!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Open the door, get out slow.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Slowly. Up against the van. Up against the van!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Give me your hand! Where is he? Where’s Ganz? Where is he?

utterance.speaker: SEEGER
utterance.content: Bingo.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where did Beckett go?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Police! Stop!

utterance.speaker: GANZ
utterance.content: I knew you were a cop.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: My name is Detective Kate Beckett. NYPD. Michael Royce was my friend. You shot him and you left him in an alley like a piece of garbage. Consider this poetic justice.

utterance.speaker: GANZ
utterance.content: He said something about hell raining down on me. I never imagined hell would look like you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kate!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Russell Ganz, you are under the arrest for the murder of Michael Royce.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So how close did you come? With Ganz?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s go home, Castle.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: And now for the hard part, kid. It’s clear that you and Castle have something real. And you’re fighting it. But trust me. Putting the job ahead of your heart is a mistake. Risking our hearts is why we’re alive. The last thing you want is to look back on your life and wonder, if only.
